alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 5:15PM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Dale County in southeastern Alabama... Southeastern Coffee County in southeastern Alabama... Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Walton County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northwestern Holmes County in the Panhandle of Florida... * Until 600 PM CST. * At 515 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Level Plains to 9 miles east of Florala to 6 miles southeast of Laurel Hill, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Daleville, Geneva, Hartford, Samson, Paxton, Clayhatchee, Coffee Springs, Chancellor, Gaskin, Kellys Crossroads, Lytle, Lucile, Darlington, Marl, Central City, Logan Field Municipal A/P, Geneva Municipal A/P, Hendrix Crossroad, New Hope and Somerset. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida.
